page.title: 02Historic Buildings(1)
page.content: {WAINHOUSE TOWER}was built by John Edward Wainhouse in 1871.It cost Â£14000 to build .The stone tower is octagonal in shape and 282 feet high. There is a spiral staircase of 403 steps leading to a balcony. {THE HALIFAX PLAYHOUSE}is 150 yrs. old and was converted into a theatre 36yrs ago.The Halifax Thespians put on many plays each year. {THE HALIFAX TOWN HALL}was opened in 1856 by the Prince of Wales.John Crossley,a famous landowner,offered to build it and lend it to the council until they could afford to buy it.Sir Charles Barry drew up the plans.The total cost was 33 000 pounds. {PIECE HALL.}A monument to the early industrial age,over 300 years old,and restored for modern use as a market and craft centre in the 1970's.
